website_summaries.verdict: It won't work in all cases, but when it does, it offers excellent ability to remove mats and tangles that may otherwise only be removable by a professional pet groomer.
pros: A versatile grooming tool that can be used on breeds with all types of coats
Handy to remove small fur mats on cats
Stainless steel cutting edge is curved for added protection
cons: Takes a little practice to learn to use it
Requires a careful hand when working close to the skin, especially on small, anxious animals

customer_reviews.title: One brushing removed the matting.
customer_reviews.text: After using a regular brush on my long-haired cat, I went back with this one. It removed huge chunks of matting I couldn't even feel before. It didn't pull her hair like a normal brush so she's happy. I swear she lost 10% of her body weight. Attached is the after-photo.
customer_reviews.author: madcow3417

customer_reviews.title: i have a 19lb super long haired main coon (cat for those who don't ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish someone had told me about this before. i have a 19lb super long haired main coon (cat for those who don't know) that mats quickly if you don't brush him everyday, and he is almost 15 and doesn't like to be brushed everyday. This tool is the best, my vet actually recommended it to me at the last visit and I wish I had known about it years before.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Otto

customer_reviews.title: This item was awesome. I have a very heavy cat and he ...
customer_reviews.text: This item was awesome. I have a very heavy cat and he has a hard time grooming himself on his back. His fur became very matted. I ordered this hoping for the best. Within about 20 min I got them all out and he tolerated it very well for the most part. The picture is gross...but just to show how well it works!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy Kitty!
customer_reviews.text: This deMatter is awesome. My poor Siberian Forest cat had matts that were painful and I would try to cut them myself with a baby scissor but she didn't like it. This brush goes thru (sometimes with a little pressure) easily. She feels so soft now. It doesn't hurt the animal at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Grooming Tool
customer_reviews.text: Our female tuxedo, an indoor cat, has been plagued by matting. She hates being brushed, but she gradually tolerated this tool very well, especially when she realized what it was doing for her. We're SO glad we purchased this. We did so on the strength of reviews, so thank you to those who took the time to write one. And thank you, FURminator, for a product that is effective and kind to pets.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Kern

customer_reviews.title: WORKS WONDERS
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this product. Our long hair male cat hates being brushed and developed several matts under each of his legs/armpits. We attempted to cut them out but was too afraid of cutting him. Though he still hates this, this helped remove the matts easier, quicker, and more safely.
customer_reviews.author: SNASH

customer_reviews.title: Be careful!
customer_reviews.text: It is very difficult not to pull the cat's hair when combing through. It might be effective for very small mats, but not larger ones without hurting your cat.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley T

customer_reviews.title: Rips and pulls, does not cut
customer_reviews.text: This deMatter will get under the mats just fine, but instead of cutting through them, it just pulls the fur out. It was painful for my cat (16lb domestic long-hair tomcat) and he absolutely hates it. I also bought the Furminator deShedding Tool, and with a pair of scissors and some patience, was able to get the mats out just fine. Skip this deMatter and just get the deShedding Tool.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Love my Furmiator
customer_reviews.text: Best thing I could have bought for my cats. I have one medium length hair cat and one very long hair cat along with two short hair cats. Wish I had gotten on two years ago. All cat owners should have one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A big help.
customer_reviews.text: We have a white, long-haired semi-feral cat. She gets terrible mats in the spring. She will let me comb her with this for quite a long time. The dematter breaks up the mats and makes them smaller so that many eventually come off without my having to tug on them. I think that had I gotten the dematting comb earlier in the season, we might well have avoided so many mats this year.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Great grooming tool for my Maine Coon
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to use on my Maine Coon Orion. Works great with limited discomfort for him. Used mostly on his tail and cutting the small matts he gets on his belly and under his legs
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Clancy

customer_reviews.title: As always excellent quality, but if you already have the Furminator you don't really need this!
customer_reviews.text: As always excellent quality, but if you already have the Furminator you don't really need this! I did a lot of research before buying this thinking it would be even easier to use to get those hard to reach spots near the ears and on the tail. But really it's not that great. The standard Furminator I already had works better.
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii Bound

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Ronan is a long haired tuxedo cat that hates to be brushed. He developed several mats on his back so I was looking for a tool that would quickly and painlessly remove them. I found it! I ran the FURminator down his back a couple of times just before he got aggravated. I didn't think it did anything until I looked closer and there were two mats in the tongs. Another couple of strokes and he was mat free and didn't get too pissed off. The FURminator de-matting tool does the job quickly and easily. Would recommend and buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Rick C.

customer_reviews.title: Another good tool for grooming.
customer_reviews.text: I have a very very long haired fluffy cat whose fur mats easily. She needs good grooming often (poor baby). I already have a Furminator and scissors and shears and combs. I still need them all but this dematter works well for the areas that are thick and difficult. At times I still do clip the mat first and then use the dematter to straighten out the rest of the fur in the area. Useful addition to my other tools.
customer_reviews.author: Mali

customer_reviews.title: Not for my puppy
customer_reviews.text: My dog absolutely hated this product and I do not blame her! It ripped out her poor hair! My puppy is a 1 year old great pyraneese mix with super long hair. Might work better for dogs with shorter hair. She typically enjoys being brushed but nnnoope she absolutely hates this item. Came in nice package and looked exactly how it was described.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for Mat Removal!
customer_reviews.text: My dear, dear cat is getting older and he doesn’t seem to like cleaning himself as much as he used to , which means even if I brush him, he STILL gets mats! In comes this de matting tool- it works super well because it goes into the undercoat and,in essence, cuts up the mat from the bottom so that it’s less painful for my cat! This thing is amazing if you have a long-haired cat. If you have one, you know; you end up with mats inevitably! It’s like a never ending weed garden, and this device makes it so much easier to fix. I completely recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Rain

customer_reviews.title: Simple and fast
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat who is too "fluffy" to reach her back half anymore to the point of matting pretty badly. She's a pretty sassy cat that wont hesitate to show you how itritated she is at what your doing with her teeth and claws. Started off with this dematter rather scared of losing an appendage to my cat... I was surprised how easily this thing broke up the matting without tugging so much on my fallen angel of a cat. Within a few short moments by cat was matt free and had a smooth coat with only a small meow of acknowledgment in response. Demon cat approved!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Effective at removing large and small mats on my Maine Coon
customer_reviews.text: My large, long haired Maine Coon is prone to getting mats, and despite using regular grooming brushes and combs, the mats were too large to remove. I ordered this product after reading reviews and am glad I did. His largest mats were completely removed within 15 minutes. He wasn't happy with me working on the larger mats, but didn't seem to mind it when I was removing the smaller ones. I gave him a break after he seemed to have had enough grooming for the day, and will try to remove the last few mats today. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Scott

customer_reviews.title: I hoped for better
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps the problem is not this product. Perhaps it is either my technique, my cat, or my relationship with my cat. However, when I try to remove or improve his matting situation with this particular tool, I need a second person to hold him down, and the session is very short. And in that short session, mats are not particularly improved. Went back to scissors. Planning to give it to a friend who has a big shaggy dog, so that this lump of plastic doesn't end up in landfill.
customer_reviews.author: flounderguts

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was hoping for
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my mom because her cat had matted spots, and this helped a bit, but after working on it daily for several weeks I ended up just holding the cat for her while she cut out the worst mats with a pair of sharp scissors.
customer_reviews.author: metasynergy

customer_reviews.title: Only for thick fur, not fine
customer_reviews.text: This seemed to hurt my domestic longhaired cat. I can see how this would work well on a cat with thick, almost coarse fur. But not on a cat who's fluffy but has fine fur. It pulled on her skin and she'd get angry and I was surprised (not in a good way) at how much fur it yanked out. Now, like I said, this would be great for a cat with thick fur but for someone with a fluffy cat with fine fur, an electric shaver is better to get the mats out.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Id def purchase again
customer_reviews.text: The photo is from 5 minutes of use on our long haired torti who gets so matted and hates being brushed. Before we were trying to brush them out to seperate then cutting the matts out. This keeps the coat even and she loved being groomed by it.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas J. Missler

customer_reviews.title: Love this brand
customer_reviews.text: We have two long haired dachshunds and I swear by all of the fur monster brushes. It's been a long summer and my poor guys haven't gotten brushed in two weeks, they had many tangles and this really swept through them... I also recommend the furminator regular pin/soft brissell brush and the furmanator de-shedder
customer_reviews.author: Alexander's Mommy

customer_reviews.title: My dogs and I both love this!
customer_reviews.text: Used this on my two Golden Retrievers and it works great for getting out their undercoat. I especially like the button that helps clear the hair out of the FURminator. Definetly would recommend this for people whose dogs have a thick undercoat. My dogs love it!
customer_reviews.author: Alison Graham

customer_reviews.title: Use with caution
customer_reviews.text: I had a heavily matted kitty we used coconut oil to "lube" his fur but be aware that it can and will pull chunks out if not careful , but it does work ! It took 4 weeks of dematting every couple of days of running it through his fur as you cant do this every day as it may be a bit painful , grooming shears are necessary to clip the big pieces out to prevent pull. He now has his beautiful fur back and we use this weekly to remove the bad fur as he doesnt groom as he use to . So this is a good tool used properly with a gentile hand .
customer_reviews.author: Penguin medic

customer_reviews.title: My cats self esteem is back along with her luxurious silky fur
customer_reviews.text: OMG! Fantastic!!!! My cats self esteem is back along with her luxurious silky fur. I brush her daily but still matted fur :( This device is THE BEST!!!! Thank you!!! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Auntie

customer_reviews.title: I was So excited about this...my pup was not as excited...
customer_reviews.text: I have a mixed breed with amazing, two layers of hair. He does not shed and really needs a daily comb trough. He was not too excited about this tool. I am slowly getting him use to it. I think it can be very helpful, if I can only get him to trust it. I am updating this post...my pup is getting use to it. The handle is very chewable...so keep it away from your pup. The tool itself has been very helpful! I almost think I like breaking up mats when they are wet. Either way..with time, I think you will find it helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: So. Much. Hair.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is bomb! I have a Persian cat who gets matted, and has to be shaved down every few months. He also hates to be brushed. I bribed him with treats, and once he figured out how much dead fur was coming off, he didn’t object as much. I got huge wads off of him with the first use, and it didn’t seem to cause him any discomfort. I’m hopeful that this will help to increase the time between buzz cuts
customer_reviews.author: chanteuse1978

customer_reviews.title: Excellent at dematting
customer_reviews.text: I was able to slice through mats that had plagued my 15 year old cat who really dislikes being combed or groomed. It’s impoetant to note the this tool does not remove the mats, but does slice them into pieces so they can be combed or brushed out.
customer_reviews.author: Tom P.

customer_reviews.title: Works Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: When I placed the order for this I was very skeptical because of its size. I own a long coat German Shepard and when I purchased him he came with a lot of matted hair. I ordered a bunch of dematting tools and by far this one works the best! After using other dematting tools I think this one works so well for 2 reasons - 1. Size of the head. Other tools with a wider head don’t seem to work as good. 2. Depth adjustment! We are very happy with the Furminator Dematting tool. We definitely recommend it to anyone with a long coat dog that has matted hair.
customer_reviews.author: PezzPill

customer_reviews.title: Demoting tool
customer_reviews.text: Good tool to have in your groomers caddy for those nasty mats. This is not a fix all but a tool to help get those stubborn mats out. I have 2 Chinese Crested Powders Puffs and they weren’t able to be groomed Professionally so I got this to help keep down the mats. They are now in summer coats (#10 blade except mane, boots and tail.) extra sharp 👌
customer_reviews.author: grdane2000

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 12 lb Blue Russian and Himalayan mix cat that needs consistent brushing or she gets matts in the fur on her hind legs. I used to take her to the groomers and spend $80 for them to brush her out and bathe her! This tool is so easy to use, cuts out the matts without leaving patches, and is saving me tons of money!
customer_reviews.author: Roger C.

customer_reviews.title: Broke before we even brushed our dog
customer_reviews.text: 20seconds after opening the package this thing broke in my hands as I was adjusting the metal blades - I did this following the directions, so be warned that the quality this is extremely poor! We have a lot of other Furminator brushes and love them, this one does not meet the brands quality standard.
customer_reviews.author: Elieke Demmer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this de shedder tool because I have an outside longhaired cat who has developed horrible hair mats this summer. I thought this tool would cut through the mats easily with out hurting the cat. I didn’t realize you had to yank them out...which is not comfortable to the cat. It ended up not working out for me.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth D.

customer_reviews.title: maybe  not best for fluffy dogs? but it works
customer_reviews.text: Its great in that in works and I don't have any fear of cutting y dog, BUT the dog I want to use in on isn't loving it, you need to move slowly, don't get aggressive or it will pull their hair to roughly, this dog has a lot of hair, it grows fast, its super soft, very fluffy, but cutting it by hand works best JUST be careful with actual scissors!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth S. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: I give this 4 stars because it does work, but it tugs fairly hard sometimes rather than cutting thru some matts, even small ones; it could have sharper blades.. Because of this, it is not my dog’s favorite. Also, it could be about 50% wider. The handle grip is superbly comfortable. It does work; after all, it’s a Furminator.
customer_reviews.author: KYRetired

customer_reviews.title: disapointed
customer_reviews.text: It seemed like a really good design as to remove mats without accidentally cutting your pet, but it isn't sharp enough to break up bad mats which seem to develop overnight on my one long haired cat. It pulls them out rather than cut them out not what I or my cat wanted If it was sharper it would work well
customer_reviews.author: Dolly

customer_reviews.title: This is fantastic! My cat absolutely loved it
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic! My cat absolutely loved it. I had another one, lost it and let the mats get away from me. This is is the best one ever and he just sits and let's you pull out the mats. Absolutely no pain to your kitty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Another slam dunk product
customer_reviews.text: FURminator does it again! My cat is still growing and long haired - i know she’ll have some matting and tangling issues, so i got this in prep. I used it on her for the first time and she didn’t mind at all!! Goodbye tugging and pulling on sensitive areas. It’s very easy to use and collects the fur very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandriabeth

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste money
customer_reviews.text: I was very dissatisfied with this purchase and ended up returning it. It was very hard to use and ended up pulling my pups fur. She yelped once and that was the end of it for us. This is the first furminator product that did not exceed expectation.
customer_reviews.author: James Duckery

customer_reviews.title: With some patience from your animal, it gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: My fat, thick furred calico accumulated mats on her back with her weight gain and it makes it hard for her to clean herself there. With this tool it does take some patience with the cat but we made a lot of progress at removing them. Cat wasn't to thrilled at first but she enjoys her coat being smooth now.
customer_reviews.author: Delanie Gould

customer_reviews.title: USUALLY VERY COMFORTABLE ON MY CAT, HOWEVER...
customer_reviews.text: A really BAD mat will still hang it up, and your cat will let you know that she - for the moment - does not enjoy the procedure. When this happens, I reach under the FURminator, squeeze the fur between thumb and forefinger and give a gentle tug on the FURminator, which - thus far - has always worked to remove the mat. It's hard to imagine any currently available product working better!
customer_reviews.author: Gil

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the best investments I’ve made. It works miracles on our puppy. She has undercoat that gets tangled a lot. This tool helps me not only keep her undercoat healthy, but prevents matting. Highly recommend other furminator products. We have all 3.
customer_reviews.author: Alina

customer_reviews.title: A win win for us and our Maine Coon
customer_reviews.text: So happy I purchased this for our Maine Coon Soks. He’s not fond of brushing, well at least not by my me. My wife and him have a wonderful bond when it comes to the grooming part. It work out great. We still have a ways to go but as you can tell even on the first try, a lot of fur cane off very easily. Our fur baby actually enjoyed being brushed. We will continue to use this while we await his grooming appointment. Our female black medium hair loves it as well. It really helped with deshedding her coat. I’ve used it on her several times sent purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: LaKishia Johnson Reed

customer_reviews.title: Game changing for ling haired cats!
customer_reviews.text: I have an overweight special needs norwegian forest cat who can’t clean itself. Plus he’s a princess. We’ve tried so many brushes but his undercoat still gets bumpy matts and large matts near his arm and leg joints. With one brush through with this ALL THE MATTS WERE GONE. Its amazing! Add in the regular furminator and his fur is silky and smoothe which is next to impossible for norwegians. Well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie R. Newell

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, worth the Price for sure.
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to buy the correct size. I have a small cat and was tempted to buy the larger size for faster work. I'm a very glad that I did not. In order for this product to work effectively and without causing discomfort to your feline, but the correct size. If in doubt, I'd go smaller that larger for delicate areas, around the ears, neck, belly, tail etc.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Regan

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: I have a main coin mix and she started getting sick so she wasn’t keeping up with her fur. I got this and with a little bit work was able to get her knots out. She actually loves the feel of it and drools a little while getting brushed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For the price, it's a good deal.
customer_reviews.text: Was worth the price for sure but didn't glide through my cats mats with ease. It took some tugging and my cats didn't appreciate it. I think if it were sharper it would have worked better. I have a short hair and a long hair cat.
customer_reviews.author: Eryn Holt

customer_reviews.title: Works surprisingly well!
customer_reviews.text: I was dubious this would work on our long-haired kitty, but it totally does! It made quick work of the mats in his fur. He doesn't like being brushed with this (or any) brush, but his fur is so lovely now after just a few minutes a day with this thing. I'm so glad I took the gamble on it :)
customer_reviews.author: afargher

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my long-haired dogs who cannot stay clean
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my long-haired dogs who cannot stay clean. It takes their mats right out with no pain. You just push the release button and it clears all of the built up pet hair into the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: JillyB

customer_reviews.title: Best brush ever
customer_reviews.text: I have four German shepherds and they shed all the time and every brush I’ve ever bought doesn’t get all the hair. I’ve always felt like I could brush them day and night and never be done. With the fURminator I get the hair quicker and I’m not brushing all day and the hair around my house has reduced significantly.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Amazing brush!!! I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this thing!!! My schnauzers easily get matted beards, despite consistent grooming. This takes care of the mat easily and as painlessly as possible! They don't seem to mind it at all, even though they usually hate being brushed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing & great price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend’a cat, she has very long hair and is extremely fluffy. Recently she’s become really matted and tangled, so we wanted to try something like this out before shaving her down for the summer. It worked EXTREMELY well and mind you she’s not a huge shedder, she doesn’t usually leave hair places, this is just what came out with this. This was a very great price for this tool and we love it. 10/10, would recommend absolutely. My boyfriend told me I needed to leave a 5 star review for it, so you know it’s good 😂
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: A must in long hair cat grooming
customer_reviews.text: My Long hair cat HATED brushing, but after using this she actually allows me to brush her. Even though I will have to detangle knots once in a while. The shape somehow does not pull her skin as much. Yay
customer_reviews.author: J. Bunny

customer_reviews.title: If you want your cat to scream in pain....
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used several of these kinds of dematters in the past without issue. This one? It did not easily remove any mats-even the tiny ones. When it did catch one, it did not cut through, but pulled my girl’s fur. I definitely followed instructions and had hoped that it would live up to the Furminator reputation, but it most decidedly did not.
customer_reviews.author: Tfoxy

customer_reviews.title: Works flawlessly!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Just got this thingy that removes matted hair from my cat. So easy to use. Works great. Within 10 mins I had all the matts removed and my cats hair is now shiny and silky smooth, once again. I Highly recommend this !
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for long haired cats
customer_reviews.text: I have an 18 lb Ragdoll who seems to be shedding and knotting hourly so a regular de-shedding brush doesn’t cut it. I was worried he wouldn’t like it but after the first use if he sees it in my hand he follows me around waiting for me to brush him out and all the knots are gone
customer_reviews.author: Michelle O.

customer_reviews.title: Not blades like a mat buster, doesn't cut matts just pulls them out.
customer_reviews.text: The "Blades" are not blades but just metal rakes. This does not cut the mat but it pulls through yanking the hair from the dog. Save your money and buy something else, your dog will thank you. I have already thrown my packaging away or I would return this.
customer_reviews.author: Unka Dave

customer_reviews.title: Best out there
customer_reviews.text: I have a long haired cat that gets mats no matter how much combing we do. I have bought ever product imaginable to de-mat (seriously, I think I’ve tried about a dozen or more combs, brushes, sprays, conditioners, etc) and short of shaving him, this is the best option out there. Blades are sharp enough to cut through the mat without pulling too much and it’s very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Hill319

customer_reviews.title: Works Great-Love this tool
customer_reviews.text: I have a long hair cat whose hair is soft and fine. She’s not a fan of being brushed and with shedding for spring she ended up with knots quickly. We’re slowing getting use to this and I have gotten rid of a few knots already.
customer_reviews.author: LivinlginWV

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Say no more, the price is awesome for a cheap ass college student like me. It’s work well, no doubt. My cat is a typical long haired with thick - THICK fur. This fur all over my tiny room and it drives me crazy. This helps me groom him so well. If you try to save as much as you can (like me), this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Mei Lee

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done, but not pain-free
customer_reviews.text: This works well to get mats out, but you do have to pull quite a bit. Make sure to hold the animals skin so you aren’t pulling them too much and hurting them. My cat howled but was so so happy when her mats were all gone!
customer_reviews.author: Joan Quinn

customer_reviews.title: WORTH EVERY PENNY!
customer_reviews.text: If your cat sheds, this product is a MUST. We have tried numerous products and none of them worked like this one did. We could not believe our eyes when we saw the amount of hair after one use. This picture is from three uses. Absolutely, worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Yara Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Does the job with no pain, pulling or crying ...
customer_reviews.text: Does the job with no pain, pulling or crying from my puppy. I use it frequently for my dog has long and fluffy hair. It keeps him looking as cute as can be
customer_reviews.author: Connie McCollum

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to get mats out of my Maine Coon's coat. He gets mats on his neck and chest, where he can't groom easily. This was so easy to use and didn't cause him any pain!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: absolutely love this, I thought I was going to need to cut the mats from behind my cavaliers ears but this got them out no problem best thing ever creates for dog grooming
customer_reviews.author: brittany phillips

customer_reviews.title: Every Cat Owner Needs One!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had bought one of these sooner as it is the best for detangling or dematting cats fur. My cat loves when I use this and she looks and feels better after. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: densnake

customer_reviews.title: Makes Short Work of Mats!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a product like this for years. You can remove mats without scalping your dog, Pretty much painless just be gentle and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Linda S.

customer_reviews.title: helped with mats
customer_reviews.text: the product was purchased so that i could get the mats out of my cats chest. it helped some but my cat puts up a fight so it's hard to say how well it really works. I'm giving the benefit of the doubt that it would take all the mats out assuming my cat sat still.
customer_reviews.author: dani

customer_reviews.title: It is so easy to use and the cats don't seem to be ...
customer_reviews.text: It is so easy to use and the cats don't seem to be afraid of it or annoyed by the grooming when it "pulls" out a clump of matter fur- plus - it really does get the mat out a lot easier than a comb. It really was a great purchase and the animals [dog and cats] enjoy it a lot more
customer_reviews.author: animal lover

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Of course less expensive would be great. But we love this! More compact makes it so comfortable for us and our pets. I’m even ordering another one to keep handy in another room so they get additional reward brushing.
customer_reviews.author: Verified Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works wonders on my Angora rabbit!
customer_reviews.text: Great for gently removing matts from my very long-haired Angora rabbit. Rabbits have thin, sensitive skin, and require frequent and gentle grooming. This is a must have tool for Angora owners!
customer_reviews.author: e.b.

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Made it easier to get mats out of my long-haired cat. Now if I could just get her to stop biting me when I have to get one off of her neck.
customer_reviews.author: Eyesee

customer_reviews.title: These fulminations are amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Works good but is a bit small if you have a big cat. Does a good job. But be careful you can thin their fur too much.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Ambrosino

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool for heavy coated cats
customer_reviews.text: Finally - something that really works to help me manage the ultra thick coat on my 13 year old cat! This thing is fantastic- easily and safely pulls out loads of undercoat, the soft downy fur, that she normally licks trying to eliminate. This helps prevent- and get rid of- mats.
customer_reviews.author: Old Schooler

customer_reviews.title: The Cats Love It
customer_reviews.text: We bought one a little while back and it work very well and the cats loved it so much. We ordered another one for our selves (we have multiple cats of our own and we do fostering for the local humane society) and we ordered one as a gift for a family member. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Semi-Crazy

customer_reviews.title: I think mine I  defective. I will return & replace as it was highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I think mine is defective and am going to return it. The easy slide doesn't move. However, this product was highly recommended by a good friend.
customer_reviews.author: Kathe

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It seems to work fairly well on my long haired Great Pyrenees.
customer_reviews.author: CJ Cravatt

customer_reviews.title: It’s a furry powerhouse tool
customer_reviews.text: Works well and is a quality product. Easy to use and really goes through the hair smoothly which aids in pets comfort
customer_reviews.author: Bryce & Stevie West

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this item!
customer_reviews.text: This didn’t go through the cats hair even without matted hair. On the cats with matted hair it did nothing except cause the cat pain. So needless to say I got scratched!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Ross

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Really small and I have a 7 pound dog. I gave up and just took her to the groomer and paid the $55.00. I should have saved my money. Too much going on and did not get it returned in time.
customer_reviews.author: Ann M. Mitchell

customer_reviews.text: I have 2 main coon cats and one of them is bold from one spot now I thought it was supposed to brush the hair not full it off 😭
customer_reviews.author: Jezebel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my long hair kitty
customer_reviews.text: My longhair tuxedo cat was matted on her chest and this brush is the only brush I’ve purchased that actually took the mats out!
customer_reviews.author: Nis

customer_reviews.title: Pulls hairs out
customer_reviews.text: This is not effective for a dog with a thick/fine undercoat. It just lulls the hair out. We have a great Pyrenees and Australian Shepherd mix and it was horrible for him. not to mention the head on it is like 2 in wide and we are trying to brush a full size dog it would take you hours.
customer_reviews.author: Tara B

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to help my elderly cat with fur matting. This sure does the job! I recommend. Just be gentle and patient with your fur friend. Daily use works best.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work fine
customer_reviews.text: I think the product is just what it purports to be, and I like it, but my little dog is having trouble liking it. She has the most fine undercoat I have ever seen, which mats like mad, and she hates the pulling involved, but it should work well with frequent use so that she doesn't mat.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Kalend

customer_reviews.title: Great for undercoat! Not as much for tiny mats.
customer_reviews.text: Could use a little bigger handle and be a bit sharper. On fairly tough little mats, like in armpits, it pulls a bit hard on a cat, and that's the tender area I needed it for most. However, it is a totally AWESOME on UNDERCOAT brush, without pulling!!! Great value, also
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Knot and mat removal for long hair cats.
customer_reviews.text: This removes the dreaded mats on my long hair cats. The don't seem to mind this as much as the straight teeth.
customer_reviews.author: LLH

customer_reviews.title: Great price - great item !!
customer_reviews.text: Is this really from the furminator brand? Why isn’t it ridiculously expensive like the other ones? It works perfectly for my dog and cat, medium and short hair.
customer_reviews.author: Hilde

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait till now to purchase one of these....
customer_reviews.text: Whoa.. this is a game changer. If you have a long haired kitty that tends to develop mats.. You NEED one of these tools!
customer_reviews.author: Team PCD

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: A great tool. I bought some de matting spray that I use in conjunction with comb. Works great mats
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Just didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Furminator de-matting tool was no match for Princess Katya II. I just couldn't work out the knots, and she threw a "hissy fit." I'll keep trying and adjust my rating if I can get this to work.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A

customer_reviews.title: Good addition to grooming kit.
customer_reviews.text: Needs to be a little sharper, but overall gets the job done. It works better on my Aussie's course fur than my Cavalier's soft fur. Overall, the FURminator deMatter is a good addition to my dog grooming kit.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: No more mats on long haired cat
customer_reviews.text: she doesn't like it as much as her normal brush, but this gets out clumps when she gets them. nice to have
customer_reviews.author: Wayne DeJulia

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Works great! This is the first thing that has worked on getting the matts out of my cats fur!
customer_reviews.author: NL AEIOU

customer_reviews.title: Works great on cat mats!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic! Unexpectedly perfect for removing big cat mats! We took in a very matted stray and were able to remove most mats, but we couldn’t get 2 very large ones. We almost gave up and we’re going to take him to the vet to have them shaved. Last resort, ordered this and viola!! Popped both right off. We’re delighted!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for large matts
customer_reviews.text: This tool may work for a very small matts-but my Golden doodle puppy had large mats close to the skin and this did not work.
customer_reviews.author: karissa

customer_reviews.title: Very good!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is excellent for helping to remove mats. I used it on my cat and it worked like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fluffy DOGGO is even fluffier now.
customer_reviews.text: My 60lb golden retriever / chow chow mix has so much matted hair on his back legs and tail no matter how much time I spend grooming. I already use the furminator for long hair, but brushing out the mattes required a combo of cornstarch and hours just going at it with no great results. Just received this and am amazed at how good it is. This will cut my grooming time in half!
customer_reviews.author: Bernadette Hursh

customer_reviews.title: Works okay, with a concern
customer_reviews.text: Does what a $5 Slicker brush does for me. I am not sure the adjustable feature is worth ten bucks. It works okay, but I am constantly aware and concerned with those pointed tips that are dragged back along the dogs skin.
customer_reviews.author: mykecusa

product_meta.title: FURminator Adjustable Dematting
product_meta.description: Color:Yellow/GreenProfessional quality adjustable DE Matter makes mat removal a snap! Matting can affect all coat types, pulling on the skin and leading to severe discomfort, pain, and irritation. The FURminator Adjustable DE Matter removes uncomfortable mats on both long and short hair breeds and should be used weekly, or as often as mats occur.
feature_bullets: Gently and easily removes matted hair
Cut Adjustor fine-tunes cutting edges for all coat types and lengths
Curved, stainless steel cutting edges ensure a safe, clean and even cut
Easy slide tab locks cut adjustor into place
Ergonomic rubber handle ensures a secure grip

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
